items.summary: No injuries were reported, but local officials warned of an ongoing national safety risk and accused the state of failing to allocate funding for coastal protection.

items.title: Netanyahu lands in Florida ahead of meeting with Trump
Snow-capped Mount Etna erupts as skiers glide down slopes
items.summary: Scientists say volcanic activity at the site, which frequently erupts, had intensified this week, with craters continuously emitting ash.

items.title: Israel crushed Mohammad Bakri for daring to express Palestinian pain as it is
items.summary: Israel turned its back as Palestinian Israeli society mourned the death of Mohammad Bakri, one of its most celebrated figures: an actor, director, and cultural icon, a Palestinian patriot and a man of noble soul

items.title: I'm in favor of establishing settlements in northern Gaza, but not under the current defense minister
items.summary: The borders of this country aren't shaped according to the needs of a political functionary facing primaries, who happens to find himself in the Defense Ministry. Settling Gaza must be done in a mature, responsible, serious, in-depth and respectful manner

items.title: Fearing deportation, Hondurans in the US send more cash home than ever before
items.summary: There's been a surge in remittances going back to Honduras amid Trump's immigration crackdown.

items.title: How frogs went from right-wing meme to anti-ICE protest symbol
items.summary: The frog has become a frequent symbol at protests against the Trump administration.

items.title: Rich and voiceless: How Putin has kept Russia's billionaires on side in the war
items.summary: Western sanctions have failed to turn the uber-rich into opponents, and Putin's policies have turned them into silent backers.

items.title: 'Hurtful criticism': Israel's education ministry gets an A in censorship class
items.summary: Education Minister Yoav Kisch and his 'order-obeying' officials are trying to intimidate educators from straying from talking points issued by the government. This is how a tyrannical regime operates

items.title: Godfather of Ethiopian jazz plays his last live concert
items.summary: Mulatu Astatke has been blending jazz influences from home and abroad for the past six decades.

items.title: Police: Two arrested in Jerusalem protest marking five years since death of teen settler in car chase
items.summary: The protesters who allegedly threw stones at police, marked five years since the death of Ahuvia Sandak, who was killed when his car overturned while fleeing from police with his four friends, after allegedly throwing stones at Palestinians in the West Bank

items.title: Anti-gov't protests ignite in Tel Aviv, Haifa, demanding answers to Qatargate affair
items.summary: Demonstrators gathered at Habima Square, calling for further investigations into the scandal involving the Prime Minister's Office.

items.title: Man shot dead in central Israel, raising homicide rate to record high of 308
items.summary: Police suspect criminal motives as a man was shot while inside a vehicle in the central Israel city of Kalansua. According to Haaretz data, there have been 249 homicides in the Arab community since January, surpassing the previous record of 242 set in 2023.

items.title: Annette Dionne, last surviving Dionne quintuplet, dies aged 91
items.summary: The sisters, who were the first known quintuplets to survive past infancy, became a global phenomenon after their 1934 birth.

items.title: Netanyahu travels to U.S. for Trump meeting as Gaza and Iran set to top agenda
items.summary: Israeli officials anticipate friction over Turkey's role in Gaza and beginning post-war reconstruction before Hamas has fully disarmed, as well as locating the remains of deceased hostage Ran Gvili. Netanyahu is also expected to push for U.S. pressure on Iran to halt its military advancements

items.title: Israel Police legal adviser who clashed with Ben-Gvir to resign; minister to seek successor
items.summary: Employees in Ben-Gvir's office had been critical of the police's top adviser in the past, in part because he believed that Ben-Gvir's decision to promote a police superintendent charged with throwing a stun grenade at protesters was illegal

items.title: Israeli soldier caught on video forcing elderly Palestinian man with amputated leg to the ground
items.summary: According to the Palestinian man's testimony, he was held for several hours at an IDF base while handcuffed and blindfolded. He was later released onto the road, where he says he was forced to hobble several hundred meters with his crutches before reaching his family's vehicle

items.title: Israeli reservist released to house arrest after ramming ATV into praying Palestinian in West Bank
items.summary: The IDF said that the reservist's weapon was confiscated and his service in the military has been terminated in light of 'the severity of the incident,' adding that he is also suspected of firing at villagers before continuing to the ramming attack

items.title: Israelis protest nationwide against government amid Qatargate revelations tied to Netanyahu's office
items.summary: A series of reports and interviews published in Israel this week appear to show how close advisers to Netanyahu manipulated journalists, including by fabricating sources, to promote Qatar's interests while Israel was at war

items.title: IDF imposes curfew on West Bank town after ramming-stabbing attack in Israel, arrests assailant's brothers
items.summary: Israeli forces are reportedly raiding local homes, and footage from the town shows closed businesses and IDF troops bulldozing local roads and infrastructure. On Friday, a resident of the town killed two people and wounded two more in a string of attacks in northern Israel

items.title: Hamas reportedly prepares to elect new political bureau chief after Yahya Sinwar's death
items.summary: Top Hamas officials Khalil al-Hayya and Khaled Meshal are the main contenders in the group's internal elections. Al-Hayya will likely continue armed confrontation with Israel, while Meshal favors pursuing an Israeli withdrawal from Gaza through political agreements, reduced reliance on Iran, and str

items.title: Eight years on, Hadar Goldin return movement holds final protest for last Gaza hostage
items.summary: Participants reflected on the unity and perseverance that characterized their long campaign, vowing to continue advocating for the return of Israel's last hostage, Ran Gvili. 'We fought, and we won – Hadar is home,' said Nahum Sheffer, encapsulating the sentiment of the movement's supporters

items.title: Yemen's Saudi-led coalition threatens separatist group over territorial expansion in eastern provinces
items.summary: The UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council and the Saudi-backed government in Yemen have been allies for years in the fight against the Iran-allied Houthi rebels. However, the Council has repeatedly defied its partners to control larger areas in war-torn Yemen

items.title: Italian authorities arrest nine for allegedly funneling millions to Hamas through charities
items.summary: Among those arrested was Mohammad Hannoun, president of the Palestinian Association in Italy. In October 2024, the U.S. Treasury announced sanctions against several charities and individuals, including Hannoun, whom Italian prosecutors describe as the head of Italy's Hamas cell

items.title: Qatar 'categorically rejects' mutual recognition between Israel and Somaliland, FM says
items.summary: 'The Israeli occupation would be better off recognizing a Palestinian state, which the international community agreed has a right to be established,' the foreign ministry said

items.summary: The meteor could be seen blazing through the night sky over Japan's Mount Fuji

items.title: A Palestinian teen left his friend's funeral. Shortly after, he was shot dead, too
items.summary: They both came from the same village. One witnessed his friend being shot dead by Israeli soldiers. The next day, just after the funeral, he too was shot and killed, this time by by a settler, while throwing stones at a road

items.title: An Israeli teacher protested the Gaza war. She's being accused of 'insulting' the government
items.summary: Freedom of expression is shrinking, and Israel is increasingly resembling a grotesque dictatorship. The case of Yael Levkovitz is a warning sign

items.title: One general, one mathematician: The men competing for power in two African elections
items.summary: The leaders of Guinea and the Central African Republic aim to consolidate power after Sunday's polls.

items.title: Netanyahu's judges are dragging out his trial amid unprecedented disruptions by PM
items.summary: Netanyahu's cross-examination in his criminal trials has been plagued by unprecedented disruptions. Of nearly 60 scheduled hearings, only 15 went ahead without being canceled or cut short. While Netanyahu has at times offered dubious excuses, his judges also bear part of the responsibility

items.title: Analysis | Palestinian politics at a crossroads: Can Fatah's pragmatism win out over Hamas' nihilism?
items.summary: However flawed, Fatah operates according to reasoned assessments, while Hamas considers no amount of death, suffering or defeat too great in pursuit of its millenarian ends. Both Hamas and Israel's far-right government must not be allowed to sabotage the Gaza cease-fire

items.title: Maybe Bennett, an annexationist at heart, doesn't really want to beat Netanyahu?
items.summary: Maybe the former prime minister prefers a government with Netanyahu to 'betraying' right-wing values, but there is nothing right-wing about racism against the Arab Israeli community

items.title: Israel becomes world's first country to recognize self-proclaimed Republic of Somaliland
items.summary: Earlier this year, reports said the U.S. and Israel held talks with Somaliland officials about possibly using its territory to resettle Palestinians. Somalia, which considers the breakaway region part of its sovereign territory, denounced Israel's move as a 'deliberate attack on its sovereignty'

items.title: Ancient humanity, surprise us: Best archaeology stories in 2025
Israel can't shield itself behind Cyprus and Greece from Turkey's vast regional power
items.summary: Netanyahu's 'triple alliance' with the two Mediterranean countries is intended as a show of force against Turkey's growing influence in Syria, as well as Erdogan's personal ties to Trump and Putin. But the alliance is a feeble one, and eventually, relations with Istanbul will have to thaw

items.title: Two Israelis killed in stabbing and ramming terror rampage in northern Israel

items.summary: Even though continuing military friction underscores Netanyahu's empty promises of total victory on several fronts, it still serves his political purposes - but any operation decision awaits the prime minister's return from his meeting with Trump in Miami

items.title: She was given 10 minutes to choose: Be killed by the Taliban or leave her people behind
items.summary: After ending up on the Taliban's kill list, Benafsha Efaf had to abandon the dozens of women's shelters she built in Afghanistan and flee with the help of Israeli activists. From her exile in Switzerland, she now works to save those left behind

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
Israelis should protest the closure of Army Radio like they did the judicial coup
The Palestinian Nakba did not end in 1948

items.summary: Gonen - who spent 471 in captivity in the Gaza Strip - told Channel 12 that she was sexually assaulted several times by various men and 'to varying degrees of severity'

items.title: Parents of IDF soldier killed in Lebanon trip present removed headstone to top army lawyer in protest of case closure
items.summary: The meeting between Gur Kehati's parents and the IDF's top lawyer was their first since the army decided not to indict a top IDF commander for his involvement in Kehati's death. 'The IDF disowns, denies its own soldier who was killed due to criminal military conduct,' his father wrote

items.title: Israeli civilian fatally shoots Bedouin man suspected of smuggling near Egypt–Israel border
items.summary: After Haaretz reported that the Israeli military did not issue a statement on the incident – which took place on Wednesday – the IDF announced that the shooting was carried out by a civilian who was riding with an Israeli soldier in a civilian vehicle

items.title: Source: Netanyahu team knew PM's pick for Mossad chief may be nixed over role in influence operation involving a minor
items.summary: According to the source, Netanyahu's appointment of his military secretary as the next Mossad chief was a calculated move, allowing time to find an alternative if he is disqualified over his role in recruiting a teenager for an IDF influence operation who was later imprisoned for more than a year

items.summary: Tsurkov's sister told Channel 13's investigative program that Adam Boehler called to inform her of Elizabeth's release before she attended a meeting with Israel's hostage coordinator, who had not yet been told of the U.S.'s successful negotiations

items.title: Nazareth's Christmas parade reminds Palestinians that even their celebrations remain under surveillance
items.summary: The Israel Police's message was unmistakable: Israel decides for Palestinians how and when to celebrate, and whether joy is permitted at all. Israel can empty holidays of substance, and then walk beside us once the optics are right

items.title: IDF says it downed two drones used for smuggling from Egypt into Israel
items.summary: An air force official described the operation as the first of its kind to use a combat helicopter. Shin Bet chief David Zini described smuggling operations as an 'ongoing catastrophe,' warning that they constitute a 'strategic threat to Israel'

items.summary: 'A leader's courage is in implementing the policies of the minister, the police chief, and the government,' Ben-Gvir said, as the attorney general requested a delay in responding to petitions seeking his removal over his alleged interference in police work, which she says violates their agreement

items.title: Can this left-wing political outsider with Jewish roots really challenge Meloni in Italy?
items.summary: Born to a Jewish American father, Elly Schlein is the first woman to lead Italy's Democratic Party, helping it regain lost ground after the 2022 election. Despite her successful, unexpected rise to the top of the left camp, many still refuse to see her as prime minister material

items.summary: Israeli military intelligence estimates that the Quds Force member who was killed is not senior enough to lead Iran to respond militarily to the assassination, and it has not raised alert levels in Israel

items.summary: The death of Sergeant Gur Kehati during a controversial security escort of a civilian in southern Lebanon might have been avoided had the IDF adopted an original ethical rule designed to prevent unnecessary risks to soldiers' lives

items.summary: In a Thursday interview, Culture Minister Miki Zohar said that 'all Israelis were complacent' in the run-up to the October 7 Hamas massacre, and that any investigation into the disaster would have to go back to the Oslo Accords

items.summary: In a letter sent to the Knesset's legal adviser, Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara warned that law enforcement officials are being summoned by MKs and told to provide information about ongoing criminal proceedings, which she says is intended 'to influence the proceedings and deter public servants

items.title: Neither functioning nor collapsing, Hamas reasserts control of Gaza amid fears of anarchy
items.summary: Even as many hold Hamas responsible for Gaza's ruin, Gazans say its limited ability to fix roads, curb looting and restrain war profiteers, alongside a quieter religious presence, is preferable to a violent vacuum

items.title: Like Israel, South Africa's apartheid regime banned foreign journalists. It's harder to hide the truth now
items.summary: In 1986, I was deported by South Africa's regime for reporting on the anti-apartheid struggle. Today, Israel's government is also trying to control what the world sees about its actions in Gaza – yet the truth has a way of breaking through

items.title: Explained: Four bills and one new law undermining press freedom and Israel's judiciary
items.summary: Israel's most far-right government in history is pushing to overhaul Israel's media, split the attorney general's power, change investigations into police misconduct – and a death penalty bill that Israel's top civil rights group says solely targets Arabs

items.summary: Norad got some help from President Donald Trump as it marked its 70th year tracking Santa Claus on Christmas Eve.

items.title: How Russia’s Invasion is Impacting Ukraine’s Youth

Social media footage showed apartments ablaze, balconies obliterated and a deep crater smouldering in a parking lot. Three people were killed and 13 injured
